We came across Sedna while sight seeing Barcelona.  A waiter saw us looking at the menu and assured us the food was excellent.  The prices on the menu were reasonable so we thought, "Why not?". One of the goals of Barcelona was to get over my dislike for Pialia.  After an expensive encounter with dried out, over cooked seafood at Cafe Sevilla, I wanted to give it a fair shake. The server steered us to the Pialia Classico.  We started with the tomato bread.  Oh so yummy.  The house salad had some of the best Parmesan cheese.  The wine we selected was excellent.  And then came the Pialia.  Half Lobsters, two large shrimp, muscles, clams and a rice that was closer to risotto. Very good. We wound it up with a chocolate dessert.  All in all, a great meal.  Then I get the bill. 195 Euro, $260.  Really? Turns out the Classico was not on the menu and was 35 Euro a piece.  The other Pialias were 13 Euro and 15 Euro. I just feel the server should have given me a heads up the the dish I was having was not the dish on the menu.I did get over my dislike for Pialia.
